snippet: The town of Iten, Kenya, which is in the Great Rift Valley, 8,000 feet above sea level, has become a training ground for elite marathon runners.
abstract: Iten, Kenya, which is in the Great Rift Valley, 8,000 feet above sea level, is increasingly gaining international recognition as the world's foremost manufacturer of elite middle- and long-distance running talent. Photo, Map (M)
lead_paragraph: ITEN, Kenya -- As Wilson Kipsang crossed the London Marathon finish line on April 22, the roughly 200 people clustered in a ramshackle theater here responded with only lackluster applause. Kipsang had established a virtually unassailable lead, so his win was anticlimactic. For Kenyans in this remote town, widely acclaimed for the marathon talent it produces, a mere victory is insufficient. More than two minutes after Kipsang won, in 2 hours 4 minutes 44 seconds, his compatriot Martin Lel edged Tsegaye Kebede of Ethiopia in a full sprint to secure second place. That sent the crowd into jubilation.

headline.main: Paths to Marathon In Small Kenyan Town
